ee1cb8986c0c.description: We write down our mess, that we may marvel in what is same about us, wonder about what is different & embrace one another anyway without condition.
ee1cb8986c0c.name: This Glorious Mess

header.description: Exploring & Celebrating What it Means to be Human. Together.
header.title: This Glorious Mess

ee1cb8986c0c.shortDescription: We write down our mess, that we may marvel in what is same…

collectionHeaderMetadata.description: Exploring & Celebrating What it Means to be Human. Together.
collectionHeaderMetadata.title: This Glorious Mess

paragraphs.name: 6cca
paragraphs.text: Today you can choose to be grateful — that you were blessed with children, that your husband, while he might be far from perfect, is always there for you, that you have a home and a job and that you have carved a unique and wonderful life for yourself. The quality of that life depends solely on your perception of it. Please, try, for me, to see the beauty that I missed, the beauty that I can see all too clearly now that it’s too late.

paragraphs.name: a098
paragraphs.text: I can feel you, because I was you. I loathed my job and couldn’t stand the person I’d become because I was forced to work a job I hated. I tried never to let on to the outside world, though. Good girls don’t get depressed, good girls are always happy. I plastered a smile on my face, just like you are doing now. But inside, I felt the weight of a life poorly lived.

paragraphs.name: f787
paragraphs.text: Thank you so much. I love your publication and the thought and care you put into it. This makes me so happy today. Thanks!

37cc340fc72.title: That was me, too, once upon a time….

bb6bff745721.title: Rebecca, you have a lot to say and I am glad you have chosen to say this bit here with us.

paragraphs.text: Rebecca, you have a lot to say and I am glad you have chosen to say this bit here with us. Thank you so much for submitting. This got to the core of me and I know it will do just the same to others.
paragraphs.name: 41ca

paragraphs.text: Thanks for reading Kristina! And for responding. It means so much when people take the time to react to a piece of writing, and it does the heart good to know that no matter what, we are all in this together! Yes, you are right, the feelings are so complex — yet, beautiful when shared. Thanks for sharing. ❤!

paragraphs.text: Thank you, Caro. Wonderful words and you are so right in your encouragement to those suffering from depression to seek help. I think the depression bit hit a nerve — and when we are able to do that, this is where we connect.

paragraphs.text: Thanks for reading, and for writing your response — we are in this together!

8d6f1f08f452.title: Editor’s pick, I couldn’t agree more.

paragraphs.text: Editor’s pick, I couldn’t agree more. Congrats, Rebecca! It’s not only that you are a hell of a writer, but perhaps more to the point: the compassion you have in you shows through the words and it hits you in the face. It makes the reader feel part of the human race and this reader in particular feels connected to all women who, like me, suffer(ed…
paragraphs.name: 30dc

25e7cc2df2d8.title: Resonates and sounds vaguely familiar…I can’t even begin to tell you how many times my passion…

paragraphs.text: Resonates and sounds vaguely familiar…I can’t even begin to tell you how many times my passion, enthusiasm and happy smiles were met with such cynicism and judgment. Feelings and changes experienced by mums, wives, and women can be incredibly complex. It all goes one way or the other, but aptly painted in your piece. Thank you for writing this!
paragraphs.name: 40c3

69bc12fd935b.title: Thanks for reading and responding Yvonne.

paragraphs.text: Thanks for reading and responding Yvonne. It’s hard being a parent. This was such a letter to my younger self and a warning for women going thru it now. See the beauty.
paragraphs.name: 88fc

paragraphs.text: Thank you so much. I love your publication and the thought and care you put into it. This makes me so happy today. Thanks!
paragraphs.name: f787

a4c9d15afc6e.name: Caro Allemand
a4c9d15afc6e.bio: European. Writer, poet, feminist. Worked on a book of misogynistic quotes about women for 20 years; time to have it published. caro.allemand@outlook.com

515d013f4479.name: Rev. Fred Denial
515d013f4479.bio: Curmudgeon at large. A Baby Boomer vintage Editor & Writer. Three Decades in journalism & publishing. I’m often blunt — I neither aspire to, nor appreciate PC.

9f0c6ac928e.name: Kristina Marie
9f0c6ac928e.bio: Enthusiast. Perpetual expat proud to have blown bubbles in front of Earth’s most ancient ruins. I blogify rants and wear my heart on my sleeve every so often.

4ce13ecefb32.name: Rebecca Marie
4ce13ecefb32.bio: It’s about words: the beauty they form when strung together, and the healing they offer when shared honestly. https://authenticangels.wordpress.com/
